title: Local Folders disappeared
content: A new Thunderbird icon appeared on my Windows desktop. I unpinned the icon in the bottom pop up bar, and dragged the new icon to the bar. When I clicked on the icon, Thunderbird ran me through a new account set up routine, and when I got through that, all of the local folders - in which I had stored a virtual library of emails from different sources that I use for reference and education - had disappeared. No, I do not have a current backup of the folders... Is there some other way to retrieve these, or are they simply gone forever? Thanks for your input, Jeff
creator: stickneyjp

creator: alcee1

title: Thunderbird emails available to anyone looking?
content:
I can't understand how to get it to work when I get the emails from the online account and they are in Thunderbird, if I go into Thunderbird they are visible to anyone who would go in! Even if the person does not know my email password, they can just cancel out of the password box and all the emails stored on computer are available!

Also, I read some online post saying that Thunderbird does not store the emails in any encrypted way on the computer!

Multiple people can use a computer, or the user may be wary of whatever kind of access somehow, simply want it secured.

Is there no way for Thunderbird to do this after so many years? An extension or anything? I want to back up email account from online account, store on computer in secure private way but this program seems against that!?
creator: xry1
